repnme.cdata!: Honduras - Fifth Social Investment Fund Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This study of the fifth social
            investment project states that the innovative Fonda
            Development and the Social Assistance and Fonda FIDAS
            Project the Innovator of children and youth presents this
            magazine as a FIDAS in photography tribute to their boys,
            girls and adolescents, institutions and implementing
            organizations including NGOs, churches and groups, the
            community of civil society showing their initiative of,
            courage and firmness in the protection of rights of Honduran
            children. This project is an example of the capacity and
            struggle for the achievement of all objectives and goals and
            how pride also has contributed to the improved opportunities
            and quality of life for participating families.

repnme.cdata!: Honduras - Fifth Social Investment Fund Project

abstracts.cdata!: The Final evaluation document of the Fifth Social Investment Fund Project contains ten Life Stories and three Case Studies. It analyzes and systematizes the information needed from the beginning to the implementation of this project. It takes into account the aspects of sustainability, the difficulties and limitations than can happen. It gives suggestions for future projects. It emphasizes the involvement of the children and adolescents with this project and how it changed their Iife, their family, the community where they live, and how they see the fulfillment of their rights.

repnme.cdata!: Honduras - Fifth Social Investment Fund Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This study on the Consultancy of the
            Final Evaluation on the subject of Children and Adolescents
            at Social Risk was held on the following projects: Expanding
            Opportunities for a  Project implemented by the Honduran Red
            Cross in San Francisco de Colonia Ia Comayaguela, Central
            District; Promises of Life executed by Poria National Child
            Nutrition Foundation Pro NUTREHOGAR in Choloma, Cortes and
            Social Action in favor of the childhood and adolescents at
            social risk executed by the Cultural Center of Hibueras in
            the communities of La Arada Gualjoco and in the Department
            of Santa Barbara. The consultancy consists of the
            systematization of projects previously selected by Fondo
            lnnovador Para El Desarrollo Y La Asistencia Social (FIDAS /
            FHIS), besides the realization of four case studies of
            beneficiaries of these projects whose impact was significant
            for them and their area of influence. The final product of
            the consultancy is a book of life stories of children,
            adolescents and girls at social risk who have participated
            in the projects evaluated. Alongside this the conceptual,
            legal and methodological framework supporting the results
            presented are found in different studies.

repnme.cdata!: Honduras - Fifth Social Investment Fund Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This paper is an evaluation of some
            projects related to teenagers and HIV. Those projects are:
            " Little people " (project that aims at reducing
            and mitigating impacts on daily life of children and
            adolescents infected and affected by HIV ) ; "
            Solidarity with the orphans of HIV; " Giving skills to
            children who have AIDS and to their extended family in the
            community of Rivera Hernandez ". A case study is also
            conducted for each of these projects.

repnme.cdata!: Honduras - Fifth Social Investment Fund Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This manual deals with the Rights of
            Afro-Honduran indigenous people in general and boys and
            girls in particular. It describes practical ways to
            incorporate those rights into future investment subprojects
            aimed at vulnerable groups. It provides guidance for teams
            that implement projects with culturally distinct groups to
            consider inclusion of the rights of these population to help
            improve their conditions of life.

repnme.cdata!: Honduras - Fifth Social Investment Fund Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Fifth Social Investment
            Fund Project for Honduras were as follows: the outcome was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was substantial, and the
            Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory.
            Lessons learned from the project: Major studies on municipal
            capacity and pilots covering an increasing number of the
            most capable municipalities provided substantial information
            on the type of mechanisms to be used to delegate
            responsibility to the municipal level. Community
            participation in all phases of the project cycle in a
            leading position as social auditors, managers, and
            responsible for operation and maintenance is essential.
            Community execution of subprojects is key to empowerment. A
            substantial initial investment in pilot efforts can provide
            considerable pay-offs. Maintenance needs a clear
            institutional arrangement and an established financing
            mechanism involving several entities, ranging from line
            ministries to municipalities and communities. NGOs'
            experience with community development is f crucial
            importance, and NGO management should be considered where
            beneficial. Training is a key component of any project
            involving communities.

repnme.cdata!: Honduras - Fifth Social Investment Fund Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fifth Social Investment Fund Project
            will continue the successful program of the Fondo Hondureno
            de Inversion Social (FHIS), aimed at increasing access among
            the poor to small-scale social, and economic infrastructure,
            at developing social assistance programs, and at
            contributing to sustainable investments. Mostly, it will
            fulfill the objectives of the Fourth Social Investment Fund
            Project, whose resources were utilized towards
            reconstruction efforts, following Hurricane Mitch
            devastation in November 1998. The components are: 1)
            Subproject financing will enable the continued FHIS support
            for the expansion/improvement of basic social, and economic
            infrastructure, including training provision in operations,
            and maintenance. Technical services will be financed for the
            design, supervision, and training for capacity building, in
            addition to consulting services for impact evaluation. 2)
            Special programs will develop local institutional
            strengthening, through innovative approaches, and
            methodologies to involve communities, and local governments
            in working together. Rural water, and sanitation services
            will be strengthened, the Social Assistance Innovations Fund
            developed, and the organization Nuestras Raices will promote
            indigenous, and Afro-Honduran social capital, through
            training and TA provision. 3) Project management include
            FHIS operating costs, TA and training.
